title: android app bunching emails together
content: The Android Thunderbird app has recently started bunching emails together in the inbox. I'm not talking about displaying a threaded view. What I'm getting is that when I select an email to view, Thunderbird opens up a small group of emails from the same sender. It doesn't seem to have any rhyme or reason to it either... emails displayed might be from the same day or different days. It's extremely irritating! It means that in order to view an email, I have to poke it once, and then again... assuming that the one I want to read is at the top of the displayed list. Why has TB started doing this, and how do I stop it? Thanks in advance, Ian

title: Bug with printing to PDF of an email message
content:
I sometimes notice something strange when printing an email message to PDF. Sometimes the PDF is not saved. No even when I complete this process.

After using CTRL-P the pop up with preview of the email message appears. When pressing OK the explorer window opens and I can select the location and type in the document name.

I noticed that sometimes automatically in the panel with all messages the NEXT message is selected (an older message not newer), in the middle of the process I describe above. So before I press OK to save the document. When I press OK the PDF is not saved at all.

In this case I have to cancel the current proces (by clicking the cancel button in pop up window with the preview). And then still the NEXT message is highlighted in stead of the message that I wanted to print to PDF.

In all cases repeating the process of printing to PDF it works fine.

That is very strange. And annoying.

Did anyone experience this strange behaviour of Thunderbird?

(if it matters: this is both with IMAP and POP3 accounts. Even with a POP3 account without automatically request of new messages. I only trigger the POP3 account with F5. But Thunderbird does not select a newer message but an older message that was already in the panel and not just added by automatic or manually checking of email).
creator: info13327

title: Вопрос по программе Thunderbird
content:
Hello! I have a question regarding Thunderbird version 144.0.1.

The server is configured locally and isolated from the Internet. There is an issue: when the network cable is unplugged (no network connection), saving received emails with attachments (for example, total file size of 14 MB) to the hard drive happens quickly — about 5 seconds. However, as soon as the PC is connected to the local network, the saving process for such attachments slows down significantly — up to 60 seconds.

I would appreciate your help with analyzing this issue and possible solutions. What could be the cause of this behavior?

Thank you!
creator: nikitamingazev579

title: Thunderbird not displaying font colors
content:
I don't see this addressed recently and the fixes from previous versions don't work. Using Thunderbird 140.5.0esr (64-bit) on Mac OS Monterey 12.7.6. Since T-bird updated I have not been able to change font colors or highlight font any outgoing email and I can't see colors in my incoming emails. I can copy and paste incoming emails into a word document and the color formatting shows up. If I write an email in a word document, change the color then copy and paste this into an outgoing email it reverts to black font. I can change bold/italic/underline.

I disabled my two extensions and tried again - no change either sending or viewing received colors

Under Settings > Composition > HTML Style "Use reader’s default colors" is checked and under > Sending Style "Both HTML and Plain Text" are checked

I'm missing something here but can't figure it out!

title: Search all local folders does not return results from Sent folders
content:
I've been doing this for (literally) decades.

If I initiate a search in all local folders, for example all messages to, from, cc or bcc a particular e-mail address, the results (as of about a week ago) now ONLY return messages found in Inbox or Trash. Also, after returning those results, the search indictor continues to 'spin' as if it's not done but still searching. None of the messages in my Sent folder appear in the results.

If I change my search to specifically look in the Sent folder, I get all the remaining messages I'm looking for. But it isn't helpful to have to perform two separate searches to get these two separate result sets.

I've tried quite a few things. Any ideas?

title: Suddenly I'm "Unable to write the email to the mailbox...."
content:
I've been running Thunderbird 145.0 very smoothly under W11 since 145 was released on esr. 24 hours ago, after making no changes to any software at all, I found that the following message appeared when i tried to download mail routinely from my Gmail server.

It reads 'Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the email system allows you write privileges, and you have enough file space to copy the mailbox'.

Does anyone else have this currently? I have used Thunderbird for over 15 years without this occurrence.

And yes, I do have write privileges (or I did until 24 hours ago) and there's plenty of space available.

I have a backup profile available but before I turn to that is there anything else I can try?

Thanks.

title: Blacklist error message
content: Thunderbird was sending and receiving just fine until a couple hours ago. Now, I cannot send anything to anyone - including my email provider. The message is: "Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: (C18) RBL restriction: Blacklisted by Internal Reputation Service" I verified all the settings (though I changed nothing prior to the problem) and all is correct. I've checked with tech' support and they verified that my address does not have a Blacklist. I've restarted the program and restarted the computer. I've also donated several times to Thunderbird. Before I change clients, I thought I'd see if anyone had a fix for this. Thanks, D
creator: lawoffice4
